Entry.content: Made up by up to two <link=Regiment>regiments\l.\nOnly ranged units and cavalry can\nattack from here.
Made up by up to two <link=Regiment>regiments\l.\nCan perform melee attacks.

Part of an army. Health is
determined by the number of troops.
Can be placed at the
<link=Front Row>front row\l or <link=Back Row>back row\l.
Determines damage dealt by a <link=Regiment>regiment\l\nwhen attacking.
Reduces received damage of a\n<link=Regiment>regiment\l under attack.
Determines counter-attack damage\ndealt by a <link=Regiment>regiment\l upon\nbeing attacked.

Army Moral determines the will of
an army to fight for you.

- Forced retreat upon reaching 0 moral
- Power can drop by up to 50% (0 Moral)
- Recovers naturally over time and by <link=Pillage>pillaging\l.

Kill a majority of the local population and
seize gold from them and the holding owner.
Also aborts any current building project.

Pillageable targets:
- Owned or Vassal Non-Castle Holdings
- Enemy Non-Castle Holdings and enemy occupied Castles

Diplomatic currency. Negative honor reduces recovery
of <link=Moral>army moral\l and increases Tyranny <link=Reputation>Reputation\l.

High honor increases Honorable reputation.

Class of citizens producing the
most tax income. Prefer holdings
with low tax rates, many <link=Market>markets\l and
a high output of trade goods.
Class of citizents necessary for Research.\nPrefer holdings with low tax rates and\nmany <link=Library>libraries\l.
Low class of citizens. Highly inclined to\njoin the army if need be.

Working class of citenzs required for
construction. Prefers holdings with
many <link=Forge>forges\l and trade goods increasing
productivity.
Each point in education converts within 1 Season\n1 <link=Peasant>Peasant\l to either a \n<link=Workers>Worker\l, <link=Trader>Trader\l or <link=Scholar>Scholar\l.

Holding with a high potential
for economic growth.

<link=CycleVillage>Cycle through your Villages\l

Military Holding necessary to wield armies.
Has a Levy and a Garrison.
Necessary for many diplomatic actions.

<link=CycleCastle>Cycle through your Castles\l
Economical Holding that can produce Flour\l.\n\nCycle through your Windmills\l
Economical Holding that can <link>Grain\l.\n\n<link=CycleFarm>Cycle through your Farms\l
Economical Holding producing Iron\l
Important food source produced by Farms\l and is only available outside of the Winter Season. Can be further processed to Flour\l.
Food source created by processing\nGrain\l in a Windmill\l.\nCan be further processed to Bread\l
High quality food source created\nby processing Flour\l in a Bakers Guild\l.
Military resource strengthening unit DEF\l. Producible in Mines\l. Can be further processed to Weaponry\l in a Smith Guild\l.
Powerful Military resource strengthening\nunit DEF\l and ATK\l. Producible\nby processing Iron\l in a Smith Guild\l.
Valueable resource greatly boosting <link=Cavalry>Cavalry\l.
Material boosting productivity.
Material boosting productivity.

Unique building unlocked by constructing at
least 10 buildings of the base type.
Requires technology <link=Architecture>Architecture\l.

+100 <link=House Score>House Score\l while controlling a Great Building
+50 <link=Honor>Honor\l upon completion
+0.2 Score Multiplier upon completion

Required to achieve victory. There are different
types of scores:

- <link=Military Score>Military Score\l
- <link=Economic Score>Economic Score\l
- <link=House Score>House Score\l
- <link=Exploration Score>Exploration Score\l

One of the <link=Score>Score\l types.

Increased by:
- Amount of troops

One of the <link=Score>Score\l types.

Increased by:
- Income

One of the <link=Score>Score\l types.

Increased by:
- Discovering Technologies
- <link=Honor>Honor\l
- Constructing <link=Great Building>Great Buildings\l

One of the <link=Score>Score\l types.

Increased by:
- Exploring Baronies
